paragraphs.title: Import python libraries and display settings
paragraphs.text:
%python

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import oml

pd.set_option('display.max_rows', 500)
pd.set_option('display.max_columns', 500)
pd.set_option('display.width', 1000)

paragraphs.title: Load the functions for Weight of Evidence and Information Value Calculation
paragraphs.text:
%python
def prior_count(DF, col, pos, neg):
    labels = DF[col].drop_duplicates().pull()
    assert len(labels) == 2
    assert pos in labels
    assert neg in labels
    return col, pos, DF[ DF[col] == pos].shape[0], neg, DF[DF[col] == neg].shape[0]


def mean_encoding_col(DF, col, priors):
    vals = DF[col].drop_duplicates().pull()
    target, pos, pos_cnt, neg, neg_cnt = priors
    res_df = pd.DataFrame(columns = ['VAL', 'MEAN_SCORE'])
    GROUP_CNT = DF.crosstab([col, target]).pull()
    K = len(vals)
    for val in vals:
        cond_pos = 0
        if GROUP_CNT[ (GROUP_CNT[col]==val) & (GROUP_CNT[target]== pos)].shape[0] > 0:
            nomi = (GROUP_CNT[ (GROUP_CNT[col]==val) & (GROUP_CNT[target]== pos)]['count'].values[0] )
            cond_pos = nomi*1.0/GROUP_CNT[GROUP_CNT[col]==val]['count'].sum()
        res_df = res_df.append({'VAL':val, 'MEAN_SCORE':cond_pos}, ignore_index = True)
    return res_df

def woe_col(DF, col, priors):
    vals = DF[col].drop_duplicates().pull()
    target, pos, pos_cnt, neg, neg_cnt = priors
    res_df = pd.DataFrame(columns = ['VAL', 'COND_POS', 'COND_NEG', 'WOE'])
 
    GROUP_CNT = DF.crosstab([col, target]).pull()
    K = len(vals)

    for val in vals:
        cond_pos = 1.0/(K + pos_cnt)
        cond_neg = 1.0/(K + neg_cnt)
 
        deno = 1
        nomi = 1
 
        if GROUP_CNT[ (GROUP_CNT[col]==val) & (GROUP_CNT[target]== pos)].shape[0] > 0:
            nomi = (GROUP_CNT[ (GROUP_CNT[col]==val) & (GROUP_CNT[target]== pos)]['count'].values[0] + 1 )
            cond_pos = nomi*1.0/(K + pos_cnt)
     
     
        if GROUP_CNT[ (GROUP_CNT[col]==val) & (GROUP_CNT[target]== neg)].shape[0] > 0:
            deno = (GROUP_CNT[ (GROUP_CNT[col]==val) & (GROUP_CNT[target]== neg)]['count'].values[0] + 1)
            cond_neg = deno*1.0/(K + neg_cnt)
     
 
        woe = np.log(nomi) - np.log(K + pos_cnt) - (np.log(deno) - np.log(K + neg_cnt))
 
        res_df = res_df.append({'VAL':val, 'COND_POS':cond_pos, 'COND_NEG':cond_neg, 'WOE':woe}, ignore_index = True)

    return res_df
    
def attach_woe_cat(DF, col, target, priors = None):
    if not priors:
        priors = prior_count(DF, target, 1, 0)
 
    woe_df = woe_col(DF, col, priors)
 
    WOE_DF = oml.push(woe_df)
 
    DF = DF.merge(WOE_DF, left_on = col, right_on = 'VAL', how = 'inner', suffixes = ['',''])
 
    DF = DF.drop(['VAL', 'COND_POS', 'COND_NEG'])
 
    _ = DF.rename({'WOE': col + '_WOE'})
 
    return DF

 
def attach_woe_num(DF, col, target, priors = None, bin_num = 20):
    if not priors:
        priors = prior_count(DF, target, 1, 0)
    binned_col = col + '_BIN'
    DF = DF.concat({ binned_col: DF[col].cut(bin_num)})
 
    DF = attach_woe_cat(DF, binned_col, target, priors)
 
    DF = DF.drop([binned_col])
 
    return DF

def information_value(DF, col, target, priors, bin_num = 20):
    if not priors:
        priors = prior_count(DF, target, 1, 0)
 
    if type(DF[col]) == oml.Float:
        binned_col = col + '_BIN'
        DF = DF.concat({ binned_col: DF[col].cut(bin_num)})
        col = binned_col 
    woe_df = woe_col(DF, col, priors)
 
    woe_df['IV'] = woe_df['WOE']*(woe_df['COND_POS'] - woe_df['COND_NEG'])
 
    return woe_df['IV'].sum()

paragraphs.title: Obtain a proxy object to the Customer Insurance Life Time Value table
paragraphs.text:
%python

CUST_DF = oml.sync(schema = 'JIE', table = 'CUSTOMER_INSURANCE_LTV')

paragraphs.title: Pick a subset of the columns
paragraphs.text:
%python

CUST_DF = CUST_DF[['CUSTOMER_ID','MARITAL_STATUS', 'STATE', 'GENDER', 'PROFESSION', 'REGION', 'CREDIT_BALANCE', 'LTV_BIN', 'MORTGAGE_AMOUNT', 'BANK_FUNDS', 'NUM_DEPENDENTS', 'INCOME', 'CREDIT_CARD_LIMITS', 'BUY_INSURANCE']]

paragraphs.title: Recode the flag variable BUY_INSURANCE for convenience
paragraphs.text:
%python

CUST_DF = CUST_DF.replace(old = ['Yes'], new = [1.0], default = 0.0, columns = ['BUY_INSURANCE'])

paragraphs.title: Save the subset table
Get the proxy object for the subset table
paragraphs.text:
%python

CUST_SUBSET_DF = oml.sync(table = 'CUST_SUBSET_TBL')

paragraphs.title: Get the categorical columns
paragraphs.text:
%python

cat_cols = CUST_SUBSET_DF.drop(['CUSTOMER_ID']).select_types([oml.core.string.String]).columns
cat_cols

msg.data: ['MARITAL_STATUS', 'STATE', 'GENDER', 'PROFESSION', 'REGION', 'LTV_BIN']

paragraphs.title: Get the numerical columns
paragraphs.text:
%python

num_cols = CUST_SUBSET_DF.drop(['BUY_INSURANCE']).select_types([oml.core.string.Float]).columns
num_cols

msg.data: ['CREDIT_BALANCE', 'MORTGAGE_AMOUNT', 'BANK_FUNDS', 'NUM_DEPENDENTS', 'INCOME', 'CREDIT_CARD_LIMITS']

paragraphs.title: Compute WOE values and attach WOE columns for both categorical and numerical columns
paragraphs.text:
%python

target = 'BUY_INSURANCE'
priors = prior_count(CUST_SUBSET_DF, target, 1, 0)

CUST_WOE_DF = CUST_SUBSET_DF

for col in cat_cols:
 CUST_WOE_DF = attach_woe_cat(CUST_WOE_DF, col, target, priors)

for col in num_cols:
 CUST_WOE_DF = attach_woe_num(CUST_WOE_DF, col, target, priors)

z.show(mean_info.round(4).sort_values('VAL'))

paragraphs.title: Imbalanced class distribution Mean Encoding for MARITAL_STATUS
paragraphs.text:
%python
target = 'BUY_INSURANCE'
POS_DF = CUST_SUBSET_DF[CUST_SUBSET_DF['BUY_INSURANCE'] == 1].sample(frac = 0.1)
NEG_DF = CUST_SUBSET_DF[CUST_SUBSET_DF['BUY_INSURANCE'] == 0]
COMBINED_DF = NEG_DF.append(POS_DF, all = False)
priors = prior_count(COMBINED_DF, target, 1, 0)
mean_info = mean_encoding_col(COMBINED_DF, 'MARITAL_STATUS', priors)
z.show(mean_info.round(4).sort_values('VAL'))

paragraphs.title: Comparison of the WOE on the original dataset and the dataset with imbalanced class
paragraphs.text:
%python
target = 'BUY_INSURANCE'

priors = prior_count(CUST_SUBSET_DF, target, 1, 0)
woe_info = woe_col(CUST_SUBSET_DF, 'REGION', priors)


priors = prior_count(COMBINED_DF, target, 1, 0)
woe_info_imb = woe_col(COMBINED_DF, 'REGION', priors)

woe_info_comp = woe_info.merge(woe_info_imb, on = ['VAL'], suffixes = ["_ORIG", "_IMB"])
z.show(woe_info_comp[['VAL', 'WOE_ORIG', 'WOE_IMB'] ].round(4).sort_values('VAL'))

paragraphs.title: Compute Information Value and attach IV columns for both categorical and numerical columns
paragraphs.text:
%python

def iv_level(iv):
 level = ''
 if iv < 0.02:
 level = 'unpredictive'
 elif iv < 0.1:
 level = 'weak'
 elif iv < 0.3:
 level = 'medium'
 else:
 level = 'strong'
 return level

target = 'BUY_INSURANCE'
priors = prior_count(CUST_SUBSET_DF, target, 1, 0)

res_df = pd.DataFrame(columns = ['COLUMN', 'IV', 'LEVEL'])

for col in cat_cols:
 iv = information_value(CUST_SUBSET_DF, col, target, priors)
 level = iv_level(iv)
 res_df = res_df.append({'COLUMN':col, 'IV': iv, 'LEVEL': level}, ignore_index = True)
 print(col + " IV: %.4f Level: %s" % (iv, level))


for col in num_cols:
 iv = information_value(CUST_SUBSET_DF, col, target, priors)
 level = iv_level(iv)
 res_df = res_df.append({'COLUMN':col, 'IV': iv, 'LEVEL': level}, ignore_index = True)
 print(col + " IV: %.4f Level %s" % (iv, level))


z.show(res_df.sort_values(by = 'IV').round(4))

paragraphs.title: Get the columns with WOE values
paragraphs.text:
%python

woe_cols = [ col for col in CUST_WOE_DF.columns if col.endswith('WOE') ]

paragraphs.title: Create a table that contains all WOE columns only
Get the proxy object of the WOE value table
paragraphs.text:
%python

CUST_WOE_DF = oml.sync(table = 'CUST_WOE_TBL')

paragraphs.title: Overview of the WOE value table
paragraphs.text:
%python

z.show(CUST_WOE_DF.head().round(4))

paragraphs.title: Split the table into train/test, prepared for classification task
paragraphs.text:
%python

dat = CUST_WOE_DF.split(seed = 1)

train_x = dat[0].drop(['BUY_INSURANCE'])
train_y = dat[0]['BUY_INSURANCE']
test_x = dat[1]
test_y = dat[1]['BUY_INSURANCE']

paragraphs.title: Fit Generalized Linear Model
paragraphs.text:
%python

setting = dict()
glm_mod = oml.glm("classification", **setting)
glm_mod.fit(train_x, train_y, case_id = 'CUSTOMER_ID')

paragraphs.title: Prepare a table that consists of customer ID, prediction results, probability and the target
paragraphs.text:
%python

GLM_WOE_RES_DF = glm_mod.predict(test_x, 
 supplemental_cols = test_x[['CUSTOMER_ID', 'BUY_INSURANCE']])
GLM_WOE_RES_PROB = glm_mod.predict_proba(test_x, supplemental_cols = test_x['CUSTOMER_ID'])
GLM_WOE_RES_DF = GLM_WOE_RES_DF.merge(GLM_WOE_RES_PROB, how = "inner", on = 'CUSTOMER_ID', suffixes = ["", ""])
GLM_WOE_RES_DF = GLM_WOE_RES_DF.materialize()

z.show(GLM_WOE_RES_DF.head().round(4))

paragraphs.title: Load the function for visualizing the classification metric
paragraphs.text:
%python


def pred_plot(pred_new, prediction_col, probability_col, target, name, settings): 
 import numpy as np
 import matplotlib
 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

 from sklearn.metrics import roc_curve
 from sklearn.metrics import roc_auc_score,auc

 conf_matrix = pred_new.crosstab(target,prediction_col,pivot=True)
 # Statistics
 cf_local = conf_matrix.pull()
 TN = cf_local.iloc[0,1]
 TP = cf_local.iloc[1,2]
 FP = cf_local.iloc[0,2]
 FN = cf_local.iloc[1,1]
 TPR = TP/(TP+FN)
 FPR = FP/(FP+TN)
 TNR = TN/(TN+FP)
 FNR = FN/(FN+TP)
 Precision = TP/(TP+FP)
 Accuracy = (TP+TN)/(TP+TN+FP+FN)
 NPV = TN/(FN+TN)
 DetectionRate = TN/(FN+TN)
 BalancedAccuracy = (TPR+TNR)/2
 # Estimated AUC via Triangle (not very precise) could be
 # AUC = (1/2)*FPR*TPR + (1/2)*(1-FPR)*(1-TPR) + (1-FPR)*TPR
 
 # Compute real AUC using roc_curve by loading the
 # data locally
 pred_local = pred_new.sample(frac = 0.1).pull()
 fpr, tpr, _ = roc_curve(pred_local[[target]],pred_local[[probability_col]])
 AUC = auc(fpr, tpr)
 
 F1Score = 2*Precision*TPR/(Precision+TPR)
 MathewsCorrCoef = ((TP*TN)-(FP*FN))/((TP+FP)*(TP+FN)*(TN+FP)*(TN+FN))**0.5
 # Store all statistics to export
 statistics = {'Algorithm' : name,
 'Algorithm_setting' : settings,
 'TN' : TN,
 'TP' : TP,
 'FP' : FP,
 'FN' : FN,
 'TPR' : TPR,
 'FPR' : FPR,
 'TNR' : TNR,
 'FNR' : FNR,
 'Precision' : Precision,
 'Accuracy' : Accuracy,
 'NPV' : NPV,
 'DetectionRate' : DetectionRate,
 'BalancedAccuracy' : BalancedAccuracy,
 'AUC' : AUC,
 'F1Score' : F1Score,
 'MathewsCorrCoef' : MathewsCorrCoef
 }
 # Nice round stats for printing to screen
 TOTAL = TP+TN+FP+FN
 TN_P = (TN/TOTAL*100).round(2)
 FP_P = (FP/TOTAL*100).round(2)
 FN_P = (FN/TOTAL*100).round(2)
 TP_P = (TP/TOTAL*100).round(2)
 # # # Print the output nicely on Zeppelin native Table
 # if table:
 # print("%table CONFUSION MATRIX\tPREDICTED 0\tPREDICTED 1\nACTUAL 0\t"+
 # "True Negative: "+str(TN)+" ("+str(TN_P)+"%)\t"+
 # "False Positive: "+str(FP)+" ("+str(FP_P)+"%)\nACTUAL 1\t"+
 # "False Negative: "+str(FN)+" ("+str(FN_P)+"%)\t"+
 # "True Positive: "+str(TP)+" ("+str(TP_P)+"%)\n"+
 # "Accuracy: "+str((Accuracy*100).round(4))+"%"
 # )
 # return 
 TARGET = target
 # Multiple Charts for Evaluation
 fig, axes = plt.subplots(nrows=1, ncols=4,figsize=[20,5])
 ax1, ax2, ax3, ax4 = axes.flatten()
 fig.suptitle('Model Evaluation for '+str(name), size=16)

 # Statistics
 ax1.axis('off')
 

 # Function to return rounded numbers if the string is float, return
 # integers otherwise and return characters if not a number
 def round_if_float(content):
 try:
 val = float(content)
 except ValueError:
 return(content)
 else:
 if val.is_integer():
 return(int(content))
 else:
 return(round(float(content),4))

 for num, name in enumerate(statistics):
 ax1.text(0.01, 
 (-num*0.06+0.94),
 "{0}: {1}".format(name,round_if_float(statistics[name])),
 ha='left', 
 va='bottom', 
 fontsize=12)
 
 # Produce Lift Chart
 ax2.set_title('Lift Chart')
 data = pred_local.sort_values(by=probability_col, ascending=False)
 data['row_id'] = range(0,0+len(data))
 data['decile'] = ( data['row_id'] / (len(data)/10) ).astype(int)
 lift = data.groupby('decile')[TARGET].agg(['count','sum'])
 lift.columns = ['count', TARGET]
 lift['decile'] = range(1,11)

 data_ideal = pred_local.sort_values(by=TARGET, ascending=False)
 data_ideal['row_id'] = range(0,0+len(data))
 data_ideal['decile'] = ( data_ideal['row_id'] / (len(data_ideal)/10) ).astype(int)
 lift_ideal = data_ideal.groupby('decile')[TARGET].agg(['count','sum'])
 lift_ideal.columns = ['count', 'IDEAL']
 lift['IDEAL']=lift_ideal['IDEAL']

 ax2.bar(lift['decile'],lift['IDEAL']/lift['count'],color='darkorange', label='Ideal')
 ax2.bar(lift['decile'],lift[TARGET]/lift['count'],color='blue', alpha=0.6, label='Model')
 ax2.axhline((lift[TARGET]/lift['count']).mean(), color='grey', linestyle='--', label='Avg TARGET')
 ax2.set_ylim(0,1.15)
 ax2.set_xlabel('Decile', size=13)
 ax2.set_ylabel('Percent of Actual Targets', size=13)
 # Print labels.
 for dec in lift['decile']:
 ax2.text(dec, lift[lift.decile==dec][TARGET]/lift[lift.decile==dec]['count'] + 0.05, 
 ("%.0f" % int(round((lift[(lift.decile==dec)][TARGET]/lift[lift.decile==dec]['count'])*100,0)))+"%",
 ha='center', va='bottom')

 ax2.legend(loc="upper right")

 # Limits and Labels for RAW Data


 # Produce Gains Chart
 ax3.set_title('Distributions of Predictions')
 ax3.hist(pred_local[pred_local[TARGET]==1][probability_col], density=True, bins=25, alpha=.5, color='blue', label='1')
 ax3.hist(pred_local[pred_local[TARGET]==0][probability_col], density=True, bins=25, alpha=.5, color='darkorange', label='0')
 ax3.axvline(.5, color='grey', linestyle='--', label='Cutoff at 0.5')
 ax3.set_xlim([0,1])
 ax3.set_xlabel('Probability of 1', size=13)
 ax3.set_ylabel('Density', size=13)
 ax3.legend(loc="upper right")

 # ROC curve Chart
 ax4.set_title('ROC Curve')
 ax4.plot(fpr, tpr, color='blue', lw=2, label='ROC curve')
 ax4.plot([0, 1], [0, 1], lw=2, linestyle='--', color='grey', label='Random guess')
 ax4.annotate('AUC ='+str((AUC).round(4)), xy=(0.5, 0.4), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
 ax4.annotate('Precision ='+str((Precision).round(4)), xy=(0.45, 0.35), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
 ax4.annotate('Recall ='+str((TPR).round(4)), xy=(0.4, 0.3), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
 ax4.annotate('Accuracy ='+str((Accuracy).round(4)), xy=(0.35, 0.25), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
 ax4.annotate('F1 Score ='+str((F1Score).round(4)), xy=(0.3, 0.2), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
 ax4.set_xlim([-0.02, 1.02])
 ax4.set_ylim([0.0, 1.02])
 ax4.set_xlabel('False Positive Rate', size=13)
 ax4.set_ylabel('True Positive Rate', size=13)
 ax4.legend(loc="lower right")

paragraphs.title: Plot the result
paragraphs.text:
%python

pred_plot(GLM_WOE_RES_DF[['BUY_INSURANCE','PREDICTION','PROBABILITY_OF_1']], 'PREDICTION', 'PROBABILITY_OF_1', 'BUY_INSURANCE', 'Generalized Linear Model', settings = '')

paragraphs.title: Compare to the dataset without WOE values. Split the table into the same train/test for classification
paragraphs.text:
%python

dat_train_orig = CUST_SUBSET_DF.merge(dat[0][['CUSTOMER_ID']], on = 'CUSTOMER_ID', how = 'inner', suffixes = ['','']) 
train_x = dat_train_orig.drop(['BUY_INSURANCE'])
train_y = dat_train_orig['BUY_INSURANCE']

dat_test_orig = CUST_SUBSET_DF.merge(dat[1][['CUSTOMER_ID']], on = 'CUSTOMER_ID', how = 'inner', suffixes = ['',''])

test_x = dat_test_orig
test_y = dat_test_orig['BUY_INSURANCE']

paragraphs.title: Build Generalized Linear Model
paragraphs.text:
%python

setting = dict()
glm_mod = oml.glm("classification", **setting)
glm_mod.fit(train_x, train_y, case_id = 'CUSTOMER_ID')

paragraphs.title: Prepare a table that consists of customer ID, prediction results, probability and the target
paragraphs.text:
%python

GLM_RES_DF = glm_mod.predict(test_x, 
 supplemental_cols = test_x[['CUSTOMER_ID', 'BUY_INSURANCE']])
GLM_RES_PROB = glm_mod.predict_proba(test_x, supplemental_cols = test_x['CUSTOMER_ID'])
GLM_RES_DF = GLM_RES_DF.merge(GLM_RES_PROB, how = "inner", on = 'CUSTOMER_ID', suffixes = ["", ""])
GLM_RES_DF = GLM_RES_DF.materialize()

z.show(GLM_RES_DF.head())

paragraphs.title: Load function for computing ROC curve
paragraphs.text:
%python

def auc_stats(pred, prediction_col, probability_col, target):
 import numpy as np
 import matplotlib
 import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

 from sklearn.metrics import roc_curve
 from sklearn.metrics import roc_auc_score,auc

 #pred_new = pred.concat({'PROBABILITY_OF_POS':(pred[prediction_col]*pred[probability_col]+(-pred[probability_col]+1)*(-pred[probability_col]+1))})
 conf_matrix = pred.crosstab(target, prediction_col,pivot=True)
 
 # Statistics
 cf_local = conf_matrix.pull()
 TN = cf_local.iloc[0,1]
 TP = cf_local.iloc[1,2]
 FP = cf_local.iloc[0,2]
 FN = cf_local.iloc[1,1]
 TPR = TP/(TP+FN)
 FPR = FP/(FP+TN)
 TNR = TN/(TN+FP)
 FNR = FN/(FN+TP)
 Precision = TP/(TP+FP)
 Accuracy = (TP+TN)/(TP+TN+FP+FN)
 NPV = TN/(FN+TN)
 DetectionRate = TN/(FN+TN)
 BalancedAccuracy = (TPR+TNR)/2
 # Estimated AUC via Triangle (not very precise) could be
 # AUC = (1/2)*FPR*TPR + (1/2)*(1-FPR)*(1-TPR) + (1-FPR)*TPR
 
 # Compute real AUC using roc_curve by loading the
 # data locally
 pred_local = pred.sample(frac = 0.1).pull()
 fpr, tpr, _ = roc_curve(pred_local[[target]],pred_local[[probability_col]])
 return fpr, tpr

paragraphs.title: Plot the two ROC curves together
paragraphs.text:
%python

import matplotlib
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

from sklearn.metrics import roc_curve
from sklearn.metrics import roc_auc_score,auc

score_dfs = {"WOE": GLM_WOE_RES_DF, "Original": GLM_RES_DF}
stats_map = {}
for name in score_dfs:
 DF = score_dfs[name]
 stats_map[name] = auc_stats(DF, 'PREDICTION', 'PROBABILITY_OF_1', 'BUY_INSURANCE')


fig = plt.figure(figsize=[8,6])
ax = fig.add_axes([0.05, 0.05, 0.9, 0.9]) # left, bottom, width, height (range 0 to 1)
ax.set_title('ROC Curve')
ax.plot([0, 1], [0, 1], lw=2, linestyle='--', color='grey', label='Random guess')
#ax4.annotate('AUC ='+str((AUC).round(4)), xy=(0.5, 0.4), xycoords='axes fraction', size=13)
ax.set_xlim([-0.02, 1.02])
ax.set_ylim([0.0, 1.02])
ax.set_xlabel('False Positive Rate', size=13)
ax.set_ylabel('True Positive Rate', size=13)
ax.legend(loc="lower right")

#colors = {"WOE": 'blue', "Generalized Linear Model": 'cyan', "SVM": 'green', "Random Forest": 'orange'}

colors = {"WOE": 'blue', "Original": 'red'}

for name in score_dfs:
 #fig.suptitle('Model Evaluation for '+str(name), size=16)
 fpr, tpr = stats_map[name]
 auc_score = auc(fpr, tpr)
 ax.plot(fpr, tpr, color=colors[name], lw=2, label="%s, AUC = %s" % (name, auc_score.round(2)) )
 ax.legend(loc="lower right")
